author: Staff Reporter
text:
Children tasting various cuisines at the International Food Carnival- 2016 at Amir Mahal on Sunday —Photo: M. Moorthy

Philip A. Min, U.S. Consul General in Chennai, inaugurated International Food Carnival-2016 at the Amir Mahal palace on Bharathi Salai in Royapettah.

A joint initiative by Round Table-94 and Arcot Foundation, the food carnival, held between 4 p.m. and 10 p.m. on Sunday, was aimed at raising funds for the Chennai flood relief. It also served as a platform to taste traditional food items of the U.S., South Korea, Thailand, Singapore and the European countries.

Asif Ali, Dewan to Prince of Arcot, and Farheen Pasha, chairperson for Ladies Club (LC) of Round Table-94, coordinated the events. Food ranged from sushi and kimchi, phad Thai noodles, waffles, shepherd’s pie and borscht. For desserts, peanut butter, fig date, citron loaves and Kahlua cake formed part of the menu.
title: Lip-smacking fare in city from around the world
